holidays.name: Marathon Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the incredible endurance and spirit of marathon runners worldwide.
holidays.origin: Commemorates the legendary run of the Greek soldier Pheidippides from Marathon to Athens, inspiring modern marathons.
holidays.funFact: The first organized marathon was held during the 1896 Athens Olympics and was inspired by this very historical run!

holidays.name: Nachos Day
holidays.description: A delicious tribute to the beloved crunchy, cheesy snack that has won hearts around the world.
holidays.origin: Celebrates the invention of nachos by Ignacio "Nacho" Anaya in 1943 at a restaurant in Piedras Negras, Mexico.

holidays.name: Saxophone Day
holidays.description: Honors the saxophone, the iconic and sultry instrument that defined jazz and blues music.
holidays.origin: Celebrates the birthday of Adolphe Sax, the Belgian inventor of the saxophone, born on November 6, 1814.
holidays.funFact: Adolphe Sax patented the saxophone in 1846; it initially received mixed reactions but became a cornerstone of modern music.

holidays.name: Bittersweet Chocolate with Almonds Day
holidays.description: A tasty celebration for fans of bittersweet chocolate and crunchy almonds together in perfect harmony.
holidays.origin: A food holiday created by chocolate lovers to enjoy this classic and sophisticated flavor combo.
holidays.funFact: Combining bittersweet chocolate with almonds not only tastes great but also offers antioxidants and healthy fats!
